intro: Capsella grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered knotweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Capsella grandiflora is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
